name: chaingraph
description: A multi-node blockchain indexer and GraphQL API

scripts.dev-cluster:init:base: yarn dev-cluster:create && yarn image:build:hasura && yarn dev-cluster:images:load:hasura
scripts.dev-cluster:init:prod-sim: yarn dev-cluster:init:base && yarn image:build:agent && yarn dev-cluster:images:load:agent && yarn image:build:bchn && yarn dev-cluster:images:load:bchn && yarn dev-cluster:upgrade:prod-sim
scripts.dev-cluster:reset:prod-sim:
echo '
## Note ##
 in prod-sim mode, the dev-cluster can not be fully reset because chaingraph-secrets contains the password configured for Postgres. Instead this script simply shuts down the cluster and attempts to upgrade. To truly sync from scratch, try:
$ yarn dev-cluster:reset:prod-sim:mv-postgres

' && yarn dev-cluster:destroy:prod-sim && yarn dev-cluster:init:prod-sim
scripts.dev-cluster:reset:prod-sim:mv-postgres: yarn dev-cluster:destroy:prod-sim && mv data/postgres data/postgres-$(date +%Y%m%d_%H%M%SZ) && yarn dev-cluster:init:prod-sim
scripts.dev-cluster:destroy: yarn dev-cluster:spin-down:bchn && yarn dev-cluster:spin-down:postgres && echo 'pausing to allow pods to shutdown' && kubectl rollout status statefulset/bitcoin-cash-node && kubectl rollout status statefulset/postgres && k3d cluster delete chaingraph-development-cluster
scripts.dev-cluster:destroy:local-node: yarn dev-cluster:spin-down:postgres && echo 'pausing to allow pods to shutdown' && kubectl rollout status statefulset/postgres && k3d cluster delete chaingraph-development-cluster
scripts.dev-cluster:destroy:prod-sim: yarn dev-cluster:spin-down:bchn && yarn dev-cluster:spin-down:tbchn && yarn dev-cluster:spin-down:postgres && echo 'pausing to allow pods to shutdown' && kubectl rollout status statefulset/bitcoin-cash-node && kubectl rollout status statefulset/bitcoin-cash-node-testnet && kubectl rollout status statefulset/postgres && k3d cluster delete chaingraph-development-cluster
scripts.dev-cluster:upgrade:prod-sim: helm upgrade --install chaingraph-development charts/chaingraph --set useDevelopmentVolumes=true --set bitcoinCashNode.enable=true --set postgres.volumeSize=625Gi --set hasura.image=chaingraph/hasura:dev-build --set agent.image=chaingraph/agent:dev-build --set bitcoinCashNode.image=chaingraph/bitcoin-cash-node:dev-build
scripts.dev-cluster:upgrade: helm upgrade --install chaingraph-development charts/chaingraph --set useDevelopmentVolumes=true --set hasura.image=chaingraph/hasura:dev-build --set hasura.adminSecretKey=very_insecure_hasura_admin_secret_key --set postgres.password=very_insecure_postgres_password --set agent.enable=false --set pgAdmin.enable=true --set pgHero.enable=true
scripts.dev-cluster:bchn:sh:
echo 'Some useful commands:

 chain info>> bitcoin-cli -datadir=/data getblockchaininfo
 peer versions>> bitcoin-cli -datadir=/data getpeerinfo | grep subver
 quit>> exit
' && kubectl exec bitcoin-cash-node-0 -it -- /bin/bash
scripts.dev-cluster:bounce:postgres: yarn dev-cluster:spin-down:postgres && kubectl rollout status statefulset/postgres && yarn dev-cluster:spin-up:postgres
scripts.dev-cluster:port-forward:hasura: kubectl port-forward $(kubectl get pod -l app=hasura -o jsonpath="{.items[0].metadata.name}") 8080:8080
scripts.dev-cluster:port-forward:pghero: kubectl port-forward $(kubectl get pod -l app=pghero -o jsonpath="{.items[0].metadata.name}") 8082:8080
scripts.dev-cluster:psql:
psql postgres://chaingraph:$(kubectl get secret chaingraph-secrets -o go-template='{{ .data.postgresPassword | base64decode }}')@localhost:5432/chaingraph || echo '
Is the cluster running postgres, and are you running dev-cluster:port-forward:postgres?'
scripts.dev-cluster:ssh:hasura: kubectl exec --stdin --tty $(kubectl get pod -l app=hasura -o jsonpath="{.items[0].metadata.name}") -- /bin/bash
scripts.dev-cluster:hasura:console:
cd images/hasura/hasura-data && hasura console --console-port=8013 --admin-secret=very_insecure_hasura_admin_secret_key || echo '
To connect to Hasura, make sure the port is being forwarded. In another shell session, run:

yarn dev-cluster:port-forward:hasura
'
scripts.dev-cluster:hasura:console:prod-sim: cd images/hasura/hasura-data && hasura console --console-port=8013 --api-port=31933 --endpoint=http://localhost:31933/ --admin-secret=$(kubectl get secret chaingraph-secrets -o go-template='{{ .data.adminSecretKey | base64decode}}')
scripts.local:postgres:tune:
yarn local:postgres:psql -c "ALTER SYSTEM SET shared_buffers = '2048MB'" && yarn local:postgres:psql -c "ALTER SYSTEM SET effective_cache_size = '6144MB'" && yarn local:postgres:psql -c "ALTER SYSTEM SET maintenance_work_mem = '128MB'" && yarn local:postgres:psql -c "ALTER SYSTEM SET checkpoint_completion_target = '0.9'" && yarn local:postgres:psql -c "ALTER SYSTEM SET min_wal_size = '4GB'" && yarn local:postgres:psql -c "ALTER SYSTEM SET max_wal_size = '16GB'" && yarn local:postgres:psql -c "ALTER SYSTEM SET default_statistics_target = '500'" && yarn local:postgres:psql -c "ALTER SYSTEM SET random_page_cost = '1.1'" && yarn local:postgres:psql -c "ALTER SYSTEM SET max_connections = '50'" && yarn local:postgres:psql -c "ALTER SYSTEM SET work_mem = '8MB'" && yarn local:postgres:psql -c "ALTER SYSTEM SET max_worker_processes = '8'" && yarn local:postgres:psql -c "ALTER SYSTEM SET max_parallel_workers_per_gather = '4'" && yarn local:postgres:psql -c "ALTER SYSTEM SET max_parallel_workers = '8'" && yarn local:postgres:psql -c "ALTER SYSTEM SET max_parallel_maintenance_workers = '4'" && yarn local:postgres:psql -c "ALTER SYSTEM SET effective_io_concurrency = '200'" || echo '
(no need to set effective_io_concurrency on macOS, tuning complete. 👍)'
scripts.local:postgres:dump:e2e:
pg_dump postgres://chaingraph:very_insecure_postgres_password@localhost:5432/chaingraph_e2e_test > data/dump_e2e_test.sql && echo "
Dumped chaingraph_e2e_test DB to: data/dump_e2e_test.sql"
scripts.local:postgres:enable-logs:
yarn local:postgres:psql -c "ALTER DATABASE postgres SET log_statement = 'all';" && echo "
Logging enabled for new client connections. If 'local:posgres' is running, try restarting it to reset all connections."
scripts.local:postgres:disable-logs:
yarn local:postgres:psql -c "ALTER DATABASE postgres SET log_statement = 'ddl';" && echo "
Logging disabled for new client connections. If 'local:posgres' is running, try restarting it to reset all client connections."
scripts.local:postgres:configure-pghero-step-1:
yarn local:postgres:psql -c "ALTER SYSTEM SET shared_preload_libraries = 'pg_stat_statements';" && yarn local:postgres:psql -c "ALTER SYSTEM SET track_activity_query_size = 20480;" && echo "
The 'pg_stat_statements' extension will be enabled when the Postgres database is restarted. If 'local:posgres' is running, restart it; if using the built-in Postgres, try: 'yarn dev-cluster:bounce:postgres'."
scripts.local:postgres:configure-pghero-step-2:
yarn local:postgres:psql -c "ALTER SYSTEM SET pg_stat_statements.track = 'all';" && yarn local:postgres:psql -c "SELECT pg_reload_conf();" && echo "
The 'pg_stat_statements' extension is now tracking all queries. PgHero should be fully functional."
scripts.local:postgres:enable-pldbgapi:
yarn local:postgres:psql -c "ALTER SYSTEM SET shared_preload_libraries = pg_stat_statements,'\$libdir/plugin_debugger';" && echo "
The 'pg_stat_statements' and 'plugin_debugger' extensions will be enabled when the Postgres database is restarted. If 'local:posgres' is running, restart it; if using the built-in Postgres, try: 'yarn dev-cluster:bounce:postgres'."
scripts.gen:client: genql --endpoint http://localhost:8080/v1/graphql --header 'X-Hasura-Admin-Secret: very_insecure_hasura_admin_secret_key' --output ./client/generated && cd client && yarn && yarn link && cd .. && yarn link @chaingraph/client
scripts.log:e2e:trace: tail -f data/chaingraph/log-e2e.ndjson | pino-pretty -c -l -t 'UTC:yyyy-mm-dd HH:MM:ss.l Z' -i hostname
scripts.log:prod-sim:trace: tail -f data/agent/log.ndjson | pino-pretty -c -l -t 'UTC:yyyy-mm-dd HH:MM:ss.l Z' -i hostname
scripts.log:prod-sim:debug: tail -f data/agent/log.ndjson | pino-pretty -c -l -t 'UTC:yyyy-mm-dd HH:MM:ss.l Z' -i hostname --search 'level >= `20`'
scripts.test: run-s build test:lint test:prettier test:spelling test:ava
scripts.cov: run-s build test cov:html cov:lcov && open-cli coverage/index.html
scripts.prepare-release: run-s reset-hard test cov:check doc:html version doc:publish
scripts.preinstall: node -e "if(process.env.npm_execpath.indexOf('yarn') === -1) throw new Error('chaingraph must be installed with Yarn: https://yarnpkg.com/')"
